remarks: Pull a scalar multiplication out of a sum of vectors. _EDITORIAL_: properly generalizes ~ gsummulc2OLD , since every ring is a left module over itself.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 6-Feb-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2015.)  Obsolete version of ~ gsumvsmul as of 10-Jul-2019.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
gsumvsmulOLD.b $e |- B = ( Base ` R ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.s $e |- S = ( Scalar ` R ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.k $e |- K = ( Base ` S ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.z $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` R ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` R ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.t $e |- .x. = ( .s ` R ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.r $e |- ( ph -> R e. LMod ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. K ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.y $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> Y e. B ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD.n $e |- ( ph -> ( `' ( k e. A |-> Y ) " ( _V \ { .0. } ) ) e. Fin ) $.
gsumvsmulOLD $p |- ( ph -> ( R gsum ( k e. A |-> ( X .x. Y ) ) ) = ( X .x. ( R gsum ( k e. A |-> Y ) ) ) ) $.
$d .0. k $.
$d .x. k $.
$d A k $.
$d B k $.
$d K k $.
$d S k $.
$d X k $.
$d k ph $.
